sentences.english: Moreover, for daylong, you should call an ambulance for me.
sentences.chinese: 再進一步，一天，你應該給我叫救護車了。

sentences.english: Demonstrate ability to direct pediatric trauma resuscitations.
sentences.chinese: 有能處小兒科創傷的救護。

sentences.english: This thesis introduces a type of portable field first -aid diagnosis bed used in field medical aid station .
sentences.chinese: 一種適用於野戰救護所的便攜式野戰急救診斷牀。

sentences.english: Important Role of Medical Helicopter in Rescue for Astronaut in the Landing Place .
sentences.chinese: 醫療救護直升機在航天員醫療保障中所起的重要作用。

sentences.english: Patients must not be attacked, and ambulances and hospitals must not be misused.
sentences.chinese: 不得襲擊傷病員，不得將救護車和醫院用於其他目的。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the causes of herniation of brain due to errors of doc tors and nurses.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析腦外科患者腦疝形成過程中的救護失誤原因。

sentences.english: The lifeguard used mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to save the child's life.
sentences.chinese: 救護員使用了口對口人工呼吸法來挽救那孩子的生命。

sentences.english: There was utter pandemonium outside the university building as ambulances carted away the injured.
sentences.chinese: 隨着救護車帶走受傷的人，大學主樓外絕對亂成一團。

sentences.english: A trainer asked me if I needed an ambulance.
sentences.chinese: 一個教練問我需不需要救護車。

sentences.english: How can I call an ambulance?
I glimpsed the dancer balancing herself on the ambulance by chance.
sentences.chinese: 我可巧瞥見跳舞者在救護車上使本身保存均衡。

sentences.english: Xiao Li, make a phone call and call an ambulance.
sentences.chinese: 小麗，到電話叫救護車來。

sentences.english: The ambulance clanged down the street.
sentences.chinese: 救護車丁當地沿街而過。

sentences.english: I just thank God and the paramedic that was there.
sentences.chinese: 我只有感謝上帝，還有在那裏的救護人員。

sentences.english: Medical rescuer becomes a new job in China.
sentences.chinese: 醫療救護員已正式成爲我國的新職業。

sentences.english: The pick-up and set-down area was soon crowded with ambulances and fire engines.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的上落區很快就擠滿了救護車和消防車。

definition: to relieve disaster/to help disaster victims
disaster prevention/to protect against natural disasters
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to meet a contingency/to adapt oneself to changes
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
